H0.text: Feedback loops are how hormones are often regulated.

H1.text: Alternating loops are the mechanism through which hormones are often regulated.

H2.text: Response loops are how hormones are often regulated.

H3.text: Intensity loops are mechanisms through which hormones are often regulated.

A4.text: most endocrine hormones are controlled by a physiologic negative feedback inhibition loop

A5.text: glucocorticoids not only perform their respective functions throughout the body but also negatively affect the release of further stimulating secretions of both the hypothalamus and the pituitary gland, effectively reducing the output of glucocorticoids once a sufficient amount has been released.
